message.content:
<<<api>>>: Apache POI
<<<code>>>: To parse Excel data in Java using Apache POI, you can follow these steps:

1. Add the Apache POI dependency to your project. You can do this by adding the following Maven dependency to your pom.xml file:

```xml
<dependency>
    <groupId>org.apache.poi</groupId>
    <artifactId>poi</artifactId>
    <version>4.1.2</version>
</dependency>
```

2. Use the following code to read the Excel file and retrieve the data:

```java
import org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.*;

public class ExcelParser {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        try {
            // Load the Excel file
            Workbook workbook = WorkbookFactory.create(new File("path/to/your/excel/file.xlsx"));

            // Get the first sheet
            Sheet sheet = workbook.getSheetAt(0);

            // Iterate over the rows
            Iterator<Row> rowIterator = sheet.iterator();
            while (rowIterator.hasNext()) {
                Row row = rowIterator.next();

                // Iterate over the cells in the row
                Iterator<Cell> cellIterator = row.cellIterator();
                while (cellIterator.hasNext()) {
                    Cell cell = cellIterator.next();

                    // Get the cell value based on its type
                    switch (cell.getCellType()) {
                        case STRING:
                            String value = cell.getStringCellValue();
                            // Do something with the value
                            break;
                        case NUMERIC:
                            double numericValue = cell.getNumericCellValue();
                            // Do something with the numeric value
                            break;
                        // Handle other cell types as needed
                    }
                }
            }

            // Close the workbook
            workbook.close();
        } catch (IOException | InvalidFormatException e) {
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
    }
}
```

3. Once you have retrieved the data from the Excel file, you can link it to your objects and perform the necessary calculations.

4. For the interactive GUI, you can use a Java GUI framework like Swing or JavaFX to display the results and provide user interaction.

<<<explanation>>>: Apache POI is a popular Java API for working with Microsoft Office documents, including Excel spreadsheets. It provides classes and methods to read, write, and manipulate Excel files. In the code example above, we use Apache POI to read the Excel file and retrieve the data from each cell. You can then use this data to link it to your objects and perform calculations. For the interactive GUI, you can use a Java GUI framework like Swing or JavaFX to display the results and provide user interaction.
